org.rsna.ctp.stdstages.anonymizer.dicom

Class Regions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rsna.ctp.stdstages.anonymizer.dicom.Regions

  • public class Regions
extends java.lang.Object
    An encapsulation of pixel regions.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Regions()
      Constructor; create an empty Regions object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addRegion(int x, int y, int w, int h)
      Add a new region.
      int[] getRangesFor(int row)
      Get an array of index ranges corresponding to the intersection of the regions and a row, where each range has two ints, the first defining the start of a region and the second defining the end of the region.
      java.util.Vector<java.awt.Shape> getRegionsVector()
      Get a Vector containing all the region Rectangles.
      int size()
      Get the number of regions.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Get the regions as a String.

      • addRegion

        public void addRegion(int x,
             int y,
             int w,
             int h)
        Add a new region.
        Parameters:
        x - the left coordinate of the region
        y - the top coordinate of the region
        w - the width of the region
        h - the height of the region

      • getRegionsVector

        public java.util.Vector<java.awt.Shape> getRegionsVector()
        Get a Vector containing all the region Rectangles.

      • getRangesFor

        public int[] getRangesFor(int row)
        Get an array of index ranges corresponding to the intersection of the regions and a row, where each range has two ints, the first defining the start of a region and the second defining the end of the region.
        Parameters:
        row - the y coordinate of the row
        Returns:
        the ranges corresponding to the regions in the row.
